main_business: Electronics Recycling and IT Asset Disposition
description: CEWS is a certified electronics recycling and IT asset disposition (ITAD) company providing sustainable, secure solutions for e-waste management. They offer comprehensive services including data destruction, ITAD, bulk plastic recycling, and logistics support, with a strong commitment to environmental sustainability and community impact through their Tech for Good program.
products_services: End-to-end Logistics Support (Smart Transfer, White-glove service, Roll-off bins, Mail-in kits)
Tech for Good Community Initiative (Refurbished Laptop Program)
Residential E-Waste Recycling (Drop-off Events, Box It and Mail It Program)
physical_address: 331 Cliffwood Park Street, Brea, CA, 92821 (Corporate HQ)
summary:
Corporate eWaste Solutions (CEWS) is a leading provider of certified electronics recycling, IT asset disposition (ITAD), and secure data destruction services. Founded in 2016 and headquartered in Brea, California, the company operates with a mission to solve the growing e-waste problem through responsible, comprehensive recycling methods. CEWS maintains rigorous certifications including R2v3 and multiple ISO standards, ensuring environmentally sound practices and data security compliance. Their services are designed for businesses of all sizes, offering flexible, scalable solutions from one-time projects to ongoing enterprise programs.

CEWS specializes in creating customized circular-economy strategies, processing over 200 truckloads of e-waste monthly and diverting millions of pounds from landfills annually. They operate multiple facilities across the U.S., including locations in California, Arizona, Kansas, and Mexico, totaling over 400,000 sq. ft. of processing space. A key differentiator is their 'Tech for Good' community initiative, which refurbishes donated laptops and provides them free to qualified individuals and families, bridging the digital divide and promoting education and job training. The company is committed to a strict Zero Landfill Policy and does not ship e-waste to third-world countries, focusing instead on sustainable recovery and reuse of valuable materials.
